unit.utterance: Ari gauni, gauni ngau stori mainangan mariu han.
unit.utterance_translation: Today my story is about betelnut.

unit.utterance: Mariu han, neuraurau ngapasimbai niu main.
unit.utterance_translation: For betelnut, I want to tell the story about coconut.
Coconut and betelnut.

unit.utterance: Wagamami ngahamam ses, bagena, mariu ti.
unit.utterance_translation: In the past, our ancestors did not have betelnut.
There is no betelnut.

unit.utterance: Ful main ti, kas main ti.
unit.utterance_translation: No mustard, no tobbacco.
Lime, there was nothing.
that was how our ancestors live in the past.

unit.utterance: Do tamat ta, tamat dino ta, han pain aipain tahaik nagenge.
unit.utterance_translation: And an old man, his wife gave birth to a baby girl.
Just only one baby girl
I was watching it, took care of her, never get cross to her, never hit her.
He/She looked after her well
And one time her father went
Followed the beach to the garden

unit.utterance: Yado, mariu main buli dahe marayongalo.
unit.utterance_translation: He went and, the betelnut was washed ashore on the beach

unit.utterance: Buli dahe i tenge mariu maine.
unit.utterance_translation: It came ashore and he saw it.
He saw it, it was very nice.

unit.utterance: Mariu main garotinan i tenge ai patun i bale.
unit.utterance_translation: The beletnut was very nice, he saw it and thought it was a seed.
Not betelnut, a seed.
I saw it, it caught my eye and I will take it to plant it.
And he took it.
He took it with him.
He left it at his house.
And he told his daughter.
"come and let's go to the garden"

unit.utterance: Do natun pain tulinge, "ong hibem wa.
unit.utterance_translation: And his daughter said, "go yourself
I will clean the insside of the house"

unit.utterance: Do ilon matanganinge yado, ai patun main i tenge.
unit.utterance_translation: And she was cleaning the inside and she saw the seed.

unit.utterance: Ai patun main tenge "garotinan," i bale.
unit.utterance_translation: She saw the seed and "very nice", she said.
And she remove the skin.

unit.utterance: Gulenge, yaratenge, yaninge o balbal kasik.
unit.utterance_translation: Removed the skin, bite it and it was sweet.
"Sweet", she said.

unit.utterance: Do taman yawe abite tore palume.
unit.utterance_translation: And her father went to the garden and returned.

unit.utterance: Mariu main wai ilon girenge palume, ai patun main.
unit.utterance_translation: Thought of the betelnut and came, that seed.

unit.utterance: Palume han abate mariu, ai sulungan, mariu nekaman, tete yendo i tenge.
unit.utterance_translation: Came to the house and saw the seed, beletnut skin on the step.

unit.utterance: Do natun pain sumeninge, "hai ai patun main sulungan gulenge?"
unit.utterance_translation: And he asked his daughter, "who removed the skin of this seed?'
His daughter said, "I."
"I myself removed the skin of the seed."

"I chewed it."
"Who told you told chew it?" and he got cross to her.
I talked strongly to her.
Got angry with her.

unit.utterance: Do natun pain main urod huninge.

And his daughter cried.
And her father came down and went to the garden
